pullRequest.body:
Implement an efficient decision procedure for `Preorder`, `PartialOrder` and `LinearOrder` in a new `order` tactic.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details><summary>

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Tactic`|5|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.Order.CollectFacts` (new file)|100|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.Order.Graph.Basic` (new file) `Mathlib.Tactic.Order.Preprocessing` (new file)|101|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.Order.Graph.Tarjan` (new file)|102|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.Order` (new file)|104|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AtomicFact`
`+ CollectFactsM`
`+ CollectFactsState`
`+ DFSState`
`+ Edge`
`+ Graph`
`+ OrderType`
`+ TarjanState`
`+ addEdge`
`+ addFact`
`+ buildTransitiveLeProof`
`+ collectFacts`
`+ collectFactsImp`
`+ constructLeGraph`
`+ findBestOrderInstance`
`+ findContradictionWithNe`
`+ findContradictionWithNle`
`+ findSCCs`
`+ findSCCsImp`
`+ instance : ToString AtomicFact`
`+ instance : ToString Edge`
`+ le_of_not_lt_le`
`+ not_lt_of_not_le`
`+ preprocessFactsLinear`
`+ preprocessFactsPartial`
`+ preprocessFactsPreorder`
`+ updateGraphWithNlt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by b-mehta.

Thank you for this! This tactic will be useful to me, and the implementation here is fairly readable so I expect I'll come back to this to learn from. I will maintainer merge this since the documentation is clear and the test cases are convincing, and hope that a maintainer who knows meta code better than me can review it better than I can.

maintainer merge

How does this behave if given some x > 0? Some analysis lemmas are written with gt, since they're part of a binder, so if possible that could be a nice thing to support too. (I'm guessing that the matching here doesn't see through the defeq of x > 0 and 0 < x, but I have no idea for sure). If it does work, it would be nice to add tests for that.
It seems to be working with `>` and `â‰¥`, probably because they are reducible. I added a couple of tests for this.

```suggestion
private lemma le_of_eq_symm {Î± : Type} [Preorder Î±] {x y : Î±} (h : x = y) : y â‰¤ x :=
  ge_of_eq
```

```suggestion
starting from this vertex. Edges are `AtomicFact`s whose `.lhs` and `.rhs` represent the source
```
If I understand correctly.

```suggestion
  toString fa := match fa.rel with
```
Untested and optional!

```suggestion
a pair `(idxToAtom, facts)`, where the map `idxToAtom` converts indices to found
```
Maybe?

```suggestion
/-- Finds a contradictory `â‰ `-fact whose `.lhs` and `.rhs` belong to the same strongly connected
```

```suggestion
private lemma not_lt_of_not_le {Î± : Type} [Preorder Î±] {x y : Î±} (h : Â¬(x â‰¤ y)) : Â¬(x < y) :=
  (h Â·.le)
```

Can this give a more descriptive error? In the unlikely situation that an end user hits this or the below error message, it would be nice to know which one it is, and which algorithm assumption broke.
I changed it to "Bug: Cannot find path in strongly connected component".

pullRequest.title: feat(Tactic): `order` tactic for `Preorder`, `PartialOrder`, `LinearOrder`
